Reviews.Title: “A one day trip that was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed an overnight stay in this hotel as part of a group of four, I found the hotel to be extremely central to all amenities. Located as it is between a pizza slice outlet and another eating place, with an excellent bakery just beside it on the corner. The beds were very soft and comfortable and to be honest invited you to stay for more than one night. Whilst there we paid a visit to Madame Tussaud's which was ,to be honest, a bit of a let down ,being in my opinion, interesting but not as got as others I've been in. I would like a longer trip to this city ,so as to enjoy all it has to offer, as I found that one night was simply not enough.

Reviews.Title: “better than you think”
Reviews.Author: disgusted83
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be more than i expected!The staff couldn't do enough for us,it was clean and very comfortable.If your only staying for a night or two this is more than adequate.They only do a continental breakfast but the hot buns were delicious, served with cheese and jam,and the fresh orange and hot coffee went down a treat especially as it was served to us in our room.What else could you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “Good for girls hen do”
Reviews.Author: mazdaqt Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a Very good location, near dam square. Good shopping in the area. Hotel was ok and worth the money. The staff were friendly and helpful when we got there. They tried hard to get us in to our room on time. Which did happen. Nice food shops near by and tourist shop for guidance. The wireless worked so was great to what's app people back home. There were 9 of us girls with three tripple rooms all nice. The only down points are that the corridors smelt of smoke which is the smell everywhere in amsterdam so cant much about it, by be a plug in air freshner! Also be careful when going up the steep stairs but again that's a common In Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Content: Just back from HOTEL DE GERSTEKORREL stayed with my 2 teenage sons from Saturday 17 March to Monday 19th, we stayed in room no 32 on the 3rd floor, the tales of the stairs are spot on but as a 55 year old slightly over weight male, i can honestly say that they only started to bother me late evening into day 2, the twist in them on the 3rd floor should be regarded as one of the seven wonders of the world, they are a masterpiece of construction, anyway we found the hotel to be very clean ie public areas, bedroom,bathroom bed linen and towels, you can hear other people coming and going and there is street noise, but you are right in the main tourist area, this is to be expected, while there we only met two female members of the staff who attended reception, they were both very helpful and friendly, one of which was particularly nice and upbeat, when I return to Amsterdam I will have no hessitation in booking this accomodation, nor should you

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Dam..”
Reviews.Author: TheFunkyDuck
Reviews.Content: After a stay for a couple of nights in a nearby hotel that was more expensive than here, we wanted to stay in Amsterdam for an extra night, so we moved on and found the De Gerstekorrel. The hotel is right in the heart of Dam, on a main street but our room which was on the first floor and overlooking the main street was surprisingly quiet. yes of course there will be some street noise, but nothing you can't live with. The rooms are small, but have everything you need. The bed was comfy (we had 2 single duvets on our double bed which was a bit odd), a TV with lots of English stations and a small but very clean shower room with toilet. The hotel generally is very clean, it has a bit of a boutique hotel feel about it, very contemporary and fresh. They have done really well to keep what must be a very challenging building in good condition and comfortable. Staff are all very friendly and helpful. Wifi was 5 euros for 24 hours (It is free I believe if you book your room with the hotel directly). If your flight home is later on in the day, there is a locked luggage room you can use for 2 euros. In future, this will be our first port of call when we visit Amsterdam. A real gem of a find and perfect for a few days in one of the most amazing funky Cities on the planet! There are dozens of cheap hotels in Amsterdam, more or less on every corner, most are cheap for a reason. De Gerstekorrel is proof that cheap can still be clean, comfy and very very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal short stay hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ndjd
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10:30 and our room was ready for us. Staff were pleasant and polite. Small but clean room, breakfast served in your room, ideal centeral location. Only thing missing was tea/coffee making facilities. would definatly reccomend to our friends and use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nothing too special but very clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: lisannickburnley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 1 night city break. The hotel is in a great location for everything 2 streets away from the infamous red light district and just off dam square. We stayed in the smoking rooms which are in a seperate building from the main hotel. The room was very clean and didnt smell like a smoking room. This hotel is ideal for all ages wanting to exlplore dam due to its central and convenient location. Will definately be staying here on our next visit to the fantastic amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Liisa A
Reviews.Content: A comfortable place to sleep in the heart of Amsterdam. Nice prices, friendly service. The location could not be better. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam's Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: RenoUKUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Kerstekorrel is our favourite place to stay whenever we go to Dam - since discovering 'Amsterdam's Best Kept Secret' in 2007, we have stayed there 15 times. It's about time we spread the love and write a review. We were first attracted to the Gerstekorrel because of its convenient location : After a 40 minute flight from Luton to Schipol Airport , a 15 minute train ride to Centraal Station a short walk straight down Damrak you have arrived at the Gerstekorrel. Just turn left at Madame Tussauds ,walk across Dam square and you will see the tiny 5EURO Gift shop. That's Damstraat - a short commercial street crammed with various eateries, a tobacconist , perfumery,Bureau de Change,trendy trainer vendor,extreme sports accessory supplier and more. Even the mighty Albert Hein supermarket (just like Tesco) is nearby as is Kalverstraat ( a busy shopping precinct that hosts most types of shop ( everything from music,mobile phones and more munchies!) Sandwiched between the "Wok to Go" and Pizza parlour is the Gerstekorrel - quiety understated amongst the hustle and bustle of the area. The notorious Red Light District is a stone's throw away as are many cultural,historic and architectural tourist attractions.Waterlooplein market is a short walk away and you can catch a tram nearby to the Albert Cyup market. Upon entering the hotel reception you will be greeted by a smart,friendly member of staff.Of all the assets of the Gerstekorrel, the staff are the jewel in the crown - nothing is too much trouble, for them - their excellent local knowledge and helpful advice is worth its weight in gold.Our group of friends are of a wide age range (18 to 40+) and the staff always made us feel welcome. If you arrive before check- in, or your flight is after check-out , there is a lugguage store and toilet on the landing available free of charge - facilities that are most appreciated by us. The option of a safety deposit box,Wi-Fi,hot & cold drinks,confectionery & various other tourist essentails, 2 choices of breakfast and so much more are all available from reception. The Gerstekorrel offers a wide range of rooms from single,twin,double,triple and quad all with en-suite toilet & shower at value for money room rates.During our many stays we have been in all the types of rooms which have always been of a high standard. The rooms are clean,comfortable and serviced daily. Each one has TV,telephone,wardrobe,bedside cabinet,dressing table,extra bedding,chair etc. Now the beds....comfortable is putting it too mildly! I have always enjoyed a superb night's sleep at the hotel- the rooms are a tranquil,quiet sanctuary from the busy city centre outside. A friend of mine stayed in bed from 4:40 am until 8pm while we were at the Gerstekorrel as the beds are superb (and he had not indulged in alcohol,drugs or anything else that tires you out so much) Purely and simply the beds are that great you could just foresake the delights of Amsterdam for such blissful rest.We even joked that my mate might even try to steal the mattress! Well what more can I say? We are full of praise for the Hotel De Gerstekorrel and its staff whom we regard as friends after all these years. The proof is in the pudding as we are going to Dam at the end of the month (again) and we don't even have to state where we will be having another enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Lib H
Reviews.Content: If you just need somewhere to drop your bags, sleep and shower, this is a great hotel. It's just off Dam square on a fairly lively street, with lots of eateries nearby. The hotel itself is really clean, rooms are cosy and the beds are comfy. The staff on reception were friendly and helpful, and they let us check in early. If you're driving (we were on a bit of a roadtrip) you're best parking at one of the P+R sites out of the city centre and getting the tram back in - we parked at the World Fashion centre: 8euros for 24hours and transport tickets to get into and back out of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - clean but only a 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: Vigorous
Reviews.Content: I was taken away to Amsterdam as a surprise for my 35th Birthday, my girlfriend organised the whole trip but she was disappointed with what we got through Expedia when she knew that for only an extra 20EUR she could have got us a room at Die Port Van Cleve, which is next to the Magna Plaza behind the Royal Palace and is a 4 star. However, the quality of the hotel really wasn't important to us as we spend most of our time out and about enjoying all that Amsterdam has to offer. We stayed for 2 nights and 3 full days, and only used the hotel to sleep in. So if like us you intend on spending very little time at your chosen hotel then you can do little wrong than stay here. If you intend on using the hotel for more than this stay somewhere else. Good for: Location - just off Dam Square Clean - the room was very clean/hygienic Cheap Bagage storage when you leave - no extra cost and do have a small toilet when you head back to collect your luggage Not Good for: Facilities - no bar, no restaurant - do not book if these are the things you are looking for Sleeping - Although I slept like a log, I can imagine this hotel being very noisy in summer/peak months. The bed was comfy but was 2 single beds pushed together, again that doesn;t bother me, but then had 2 sigle duvets that overlapped which wasn't good. Bathroom - whiclst clean the bathroom was one big wet room, no bath, just a shower with a hole in the floor. Size - Lke most places in Amsterdam the room was small Overall the hotel served its purpose for us, but would maybe look again if we go back. TIP: When you're out and wanting a drink, don't specify the size of drink you want, it somehow works out cheaper. And of course try the wheat beer!! : - ) Some must-see places are: Anne Franks Huis Van Gogh Museum Boat Trip Eating & Drinking Pastini - Italian Restaurant, spent around 70 EUR on 2 courses and a bottle of Red Wine, beautiful food, and lovely candle lit restaurant off the beaten track on the Southern Canal District Hoppe - Cool bar, busy but not overpriced in the southern Canal District Cafe Van Zuylen - Candle lit Cafe/Bar, this place was our favourite, again off the beaten track behind the Royal Palace 5 EUR for two beverages, candle lit and the food looked amazing although we didn't try Cafe Heuvel - Lovely Cafe/Bar in the Old South, if you go to the Van Gogh Museum, pop in here for a beer or Coffee, the lady that runs this place obvioulsy loves what she does and it shows in the way in which she runs it. Cafe Scheltema - My friend who lives in Amsterdam recommended this place for breakfast and I can thoroughyl pass on this recommendation, great breakfast - We both had the Eggs with Ham & Cheese and needed nothing else until dinner time - cost 18 EUR for 2 coffees and a proper breakfast. Also, if you hungry at the airport, go to the pizza & pasta place in main departures, was awesome - 7 EUR for pasta which comes in a carbaord box (like the movies) and the portions are huge and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Location was fantastic, room was as expected”
Reviews.Author: illgothere
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights November 2011 - The location is great, just a few steps from Dam square, about a 10-minute walk from Amsterdal Centraal train station, and walking distance to tourist attractions. The room was exactly as expected for a budget hotel in Europe, and I will give it good reviews based on that expectation. It was clean, bed was comfortable, everything worked, staff was friendly as they were able to offer assistance on seeing the sights and how to get around. Was on the second floor, stairs are steep and narrow and no elevator. Room temperature was fine in November. I would definitely recommend this hotel to tourists on a budget that don't plan on spending a lot of time in their room and want to stay in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, dissapointing room.”
Reviews.Author: grouse357
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the good reviews. The location couldn't be better, right next to Dam square and in the middle of everything. There are loads of places to eat and there is a great little cake/cafe nearby. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. We were given a room in the annexe which is about 4 doors away from the main hotel, as soon as you walk in the front door you can smell the cigarrette/cannabis smoke and it is not pleasant. The stairs are very steep in common with most houses in Amsterdam. We were on the second floor which meant the climb was not too bad but it also meant that the occupants of the 5 rooms past ours woke us up every time the came in or went out. There seemed to be a lot of young females staying in these rooms and they were very noisy. The hotel staff have no control as there is no connection with the main hotel. We were at the back of the building so niose from the street was not a problem. There is no view from the window. The room was very small, just about big enough for a double bed. The room was cleaned each day and towels changed. If the hotel management enforced a no-smoking policy in this building then I would have given it a much better rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, however expensive”
Reviews.Author: atork
Reviews.Content: Personnel was very kind and helpful during my stay. Many attractions were at walking distance. However, the amount I have paid for two nights was too high for me, especially since it was the time when exchange rate for Euro was too high. It was a small room with two very narrow beds. Considering the size of my body, it was not easy to sleep for me. And also, as it has been mentioned before, the stairs are very steep and if you have a large luggage, then you have a problem if you are not very much athletic and your room is at the fourth floor, as in my case.

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: yfleming
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3nights in october.the hotel was clean and staff friendly,it was cold but rooms have central heating,take a hair dryer girls,we were room only but right next door is a chiness take away wok in a box,which is handy after a night out on the ale which the hotel let you take back to your room.next to that is the best cake shop ever, then a cafe after that which do a good breakfast for 7.50euro.the train is so easy to get from the airport to dam central and its only 8.50euro return.we were charged 5% tax at the hotel and had to give them 20euros on arrivel.The anne frank house is one to see, your in a queue for 30 mins and its 8.50euros each takes about an hour to walk round.Theres no lift in the hotel we were on the 3rd floor and being 50 it was a killer for me,but saying that we would stay here again we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sanna_helsinki
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel de Gerstekorrel for three nights in October. The hotel is right there in the city centre, a walking distance to the Amsterdam central railway station, many sights and shopping areas. Great location, helpfull staff, clean rooms. I would stay there again. The hotel has no breakfast room, but breakfast can be ordered to your room (there is a choice of "small breakfast" and normal breakfast. If you're not busy (and the breakfast is not included in the price), you might be better off finding a nice cafe in the neirbourghood. The hotel has no elevator, so if you have trouble climbing the stairs, ask for a room on the first floor. If possible ask for a room that is not facing Damstraat, as it can be somewhat noisy. Tip for Finnish travellers: most of the staff speaks Finnish. :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: hayleyw86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to dam square, local shops and local tourist attactions. The hotel staff are really friendly and you get breakfast in bed in the morning, you arrange a time with the staff and it is there waiting on your door step. The rooms were spacious and clean and excellent value for money. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone as everything is on your door step.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.. we would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: archie033
Reviews.Content: The staff here at the hotel were great, all so friendly and helpful. They also all speak great english for any english people planning to stay there! The stairs were very steep (we were on the 2nd floor which wasn't too bad) but there are no lifts and so we wouldn't recommend it for people with walking difficulties. The location of the hotel is AMAZING!! its just off Dam Square and its in the centre of everything! Our room and bathroom were very small but they were perfect as we didnt want to spend lots of time in the hotel. It also didn't really look anything like the pictures on their website! The bed in the room was also the comfiest bed I've ever slept in and the room was cleaned every day by the maids. However, there was only one window which only opened a slight bit which didn't let very much fresh air in so if it hadn't of been for the fan that was in our room we probably wouldn't have been able to stick it as it was so warm in the room constantly (especially when someone had a shower!) Another thing was that in the mornings the cleaners in the hotel were very very noisy and so we were woke up by that every morning at about 9 or half 9! Despite this we would definitely stay here again as we found this hotel to be great for what we wanted and it was right in the centre of everything. The staff at reception were all great, really really friendly, polite and helpful! Would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a great hotel in the centre of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ikkiryyn
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in a triple room for three nights. The room was in the first floor towards the back of the hotel so we couldn't hear any street noise during the night. Furthermore, our room was very spacious. It was really a triple room and not just a double room with an extra bed. We were very positively surprised! The bathroom was also big enough for the three of us. The TV had dozens of channels and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and it didn't hurt that most of them could speak Finnish with us. We had an early arrival and a late departure but we could leave our luggage in the luggage room. The staff was also very helpful and readily answered all of our questions (at the hotel and through e-mail already less than an hour after we had made our reservation through ebookers). The reception was open 24/7. The location was great! We only had to use public transportation to get to the airport. All the museums, shopping streets, sights, parks etc. were within walking distance. The walk to the central railway station only took about 15 minutes. We didn't try the hotel's own breakfast but there were many grocery stores, cafes and restaurants nearby. The nearest ones were in the same building. You'll never go to bed hungry! All in all, our stay at the hotel was very pleasant. The only negative side I can think of is the fact that our room didn't have its own hairdryer. If we wanted one, we had to borrow it from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Beekysky
Reviews.Content: Booked this through DFDS seaways city break. One night. Good location, near Dam Square (not "5 minutes" walk, more like 10 from drop off point), but well-located for City Centre activities. Busy street, but room was quiet and clean. Small Shower room, but again, clean and functional. Breakfast continental delivered to room, small but adequate. Friendly reception. No complaints. Sure the room was small-ish, but if you spend most of your time out it doesn't matter. TV could use relocation, though. The flat screen wasn't visible from the bed-angle. Would recommend for City Centre short breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bella-Pumpkin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's superb location. Within walking distance to the main train station, shopping area, attraction etc.there are plenty of restaurants just next door and also a very nice bakery nearby for a quick bite. The room we stayed was in 3rd floor was very small but also very clean.there was no lift and it will be quite a challege if u have large luggage.if u need a luxury hotel, this is not for u. Despite the room n the narrow, steep staircase, we were greeted warmly at the reception and the whole stay.the staffs were very helpful, friendly people who helped and made our stay in amsterdam a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “My Closet is Bigger Than the Room”
Reviews.Author: YogaGirlOhio
Reviews.Content: Without doubt, if you're looking for a great locale that's easy to find and close to the train station as well as the action of Amsterdam, this is your place. However, if you and your mate want to walk around the room at the same time or if you carry large luggage, consider another place. I have a bigger closet than the room in which I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: chris1978brown
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for our 1st wedding anniversary and chose the hotel based on location and cost. We couldn't fault the location it is central to the town centre and near the train station - 10/15mins walk. However the pictures on the website of the rooms are very generous. We stayed on the 4th (top) floor, which meant a very steep climb to get to our room - not the best after a long day exploring but having said that, the room was clean if a little small and basic. If you just want a place to rest your head then this hotel fits the bill but it does suffer from being noisy on a weekend as it is right near all the bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: giabee
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low budget hotel this is your place. the location is central to damstraat so you are in the middle of everything. I am a frequent Amsterdam visitor and although the rooms were small they were clean and wireless worked well. Front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. It is on a busy street so it can be noisy at night but we were on the top floor and heard nothing. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value and location”
Reviews.Author: deansmith333
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Gerstekorrel is literally two minutes away from dam square and therefore in a prime location. On three different stays i've had three different rooms each one being as spacious and clean as the last. The noise from the street below can be an issue however it is only what is to be expected from a hotel in a built up, sleepless city. The rooms have a hairdryer and TV with a good selection of channels as standard along with other amenities such as kettle, tea and coffee. Also the complimentary continental breakfast is a nice touch which is brought to your room in the morning on a time that you specify to the staff during check-in. The staff are happy to help you with any queries you have and also snacks and drinks can be purchased from the reception 24 hours. One note is that the building does not have a lift and Amsterdam is notorious for its big steep staircases, so if you happen to be on a higher floor expect to burn some calories. This hotel is definitely a hidden gem for its location and great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION - CLEAN, FRIENDLY, BRILLIANT!!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeHale1
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with my boyfriend Sunday-Thursday 13th-17th February 2011 and have to say how brilliant it was. As I am a student we don't have masses of spare money, but we spent quite a while working out what hotel to stay in when in Amsterdam. Do not be put off that it is classed as "red light district" as it really isn't, it is right next to Madam Tussauds and by loads of shops, there are no coffee shops/ women in windows directly nearby, just a few restaurants which leads down to the red light district. When we arrived in Schipol (Amsterdams airport) we had already worked out that we could take the train into Amsterdam as a cheaper option than a taxi. We got the train which I believe was 4 euro each. When we arrived in Amsterdam it is literally just a straight line down past loads of shops and restaurants towards the hotel. We also walked to the train station when it was time to go home, the walk takes no longer than 20 minutes. Just follow the tram lines. The hotel itself could not be in a better location - close enough to stagger back from if you've had one too many (!) but far away enough to not be in the middle of the red light district. Even though there is a lot of hustle and bustle on the street it is on, our room was completely silent and could catch an excellent nights sleep! The receptionists were lovely and you have no curfew as to when you can come in, there is someone on reception 24 hours also. The beds are extremely comfy memory foam very hard to get out of! Bathroom a little small but what do you want from a budget hotel. The only thing I would say is there is no lift - bit hard being on the 4th floor, but you soon get used to it. All in all we LOVED this hotel and couldn't of asked for anywhere better! Definitely would recommend, and would definitely go back! PS you MUST try the chip place a few shops to the right of the Gerstekorrel. DELICIOUS!!! especially after smoking a bit ;)

Reviews.Title: “Within Walking Distance to the Best of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: mannurse123
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is located just 3 mins from Dam Square and about 5 mins from the Red Light District! My friends and I loved its central location, staff and the extremely comfortable beds. We had a 1 triple and 1 twin room, both with ensuite washrooms that were simple, but functional. The hotel was a bit noisy in the evenings, due to being located in the heart of the city, but the location was worth a bit of noise. There is no elevator or lounge, but it was a great little place that I would revisit if I am in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, okay hotel for a tight budget.”
Reviews.Author: turtlesturtles
Reviews.Content: my wife and i had a blast in amsterdam. we rented bicycles and rode around everywhere. what a great city. hotel is right in the middle of everything. definitely not a luxury hotel. no elevator, but we needed to work off the calories somehow! not really a good hotel for romance though. i think if you're working with a tight budget, and you can tolerate low level accomodations, then this place should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, but filthy and bad value”
Reviews.Author: BernWaBe
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in this Hotel in April 2011. The Hotel is situated very central, just two minutes from dam square in one and another two minutes from the redlight-district in the opposite direction. The rooms are quite small and without any luxury, just as you'd expect from a **-Hotel. However, to my understanding, a classification of two stars justifies a lower level of provided services. It does certainly not mean a two-star-hotel does not have to be clean, and that's exactly what the Gerstekorrel isn't. We got a room in the seperate part of the Hotel, of which the entrance is a couple of doors down the street. Allready when entering the stairs, you encounter a stench consisting of cleaning essences, cannabis-fumes, smoke and vomit. Although the hotel is officially smoke-free, also in the rooms there is a permanent smell of tobacco and marihuana-smoke. The hotel management does not seem to be interested in insisting on these rules... Our room was made very poorly, no vacum cleaning during the whole five days, just the bed has been made and the rubish been emptied. The carpet made a very disgusting impression. One day, despite we left the room before 9:30am, when returning at night we noticed the room had not been made up at all. Last but not least, the walls are not sound-proof at all. Sleeping without earplugs is nearly impossible, but we expected that due to the location of the hotel, so this point was no bad surprise. However, the fact that the hotel charges arround 200.00 EUR a night for its "services" made it one of the worst value hotels we've ever encountered. Thatfor, despite the very central location, we dissuade anybody from staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but hotel rooms need refurb”
Reviews.Author: Smurf64london
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid this hotel didn't live up to expectations .The location was superb 5 mins walk in any direction got you to where u wanted to go !!BUT the room was tiny & very sparse & very outdated .Staff were friendly enough but when we arrived our room as a smoking room which we never wanted but they moved us to non smoking part of hotel ...perhaps the smoking section had the rooms they show on website because we certainly never did. FAR TOO MANY STAIRS TO CLIMB !!For the price we paid tea/coffee making facilities in rooms should be inc as should breakfast !! paul & caz

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: Indukcija
Reviews.Content: When booking, be careful not to book a single room - they will charge more for 2 people. I had to upgrade to a room when I got there and it ended up being too expensive (but crap). Pro: Right by Dam Square right by Red Light District Vicinity of restaurants and bars Con: very noisy (throughout the night) not very clean very small rooms and miniature bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location (but Noisy Street at Night)”
Reviews.Author: 1GillianLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here beginning of March 2011 with my Boyfriend on a weekend trip. The location is great and only a 5-7 minute walk from Central Station (you can get the train from Schipol Airport). Literally 30-second walk from Dam Square and 5-10 min walk from Red Light District. Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean room with TV (no tea/coffee making facilities in room - drinks and snacks available from downstairs 24-hr reception at extra cost). Room size quite small but was fine for us. Chip shop, Wok-to-Go (LOVELY!!) and Cake/Pastry shop all next door / next door but one to Hotel. Only negative would be that the Street that the hotel is on is very lively at night. There are a few pubs/bars on the Street but the noise seemed to come mainly from people just walking by and chatting waiting for chips etc. Becuase we were drinking in the day we would be back in our room by 10pm shattered but the Street stayed really busy until around 5am. Would stay again for location and price as could handle being woken up throughout the night for a weekend. Would reccommend 'Things to Do': - Heineken Tour - Canal Cruise/Tour - Ajax Football Staium Tour Beware of bikes in Amsetrdam they are everywhere - I nearly got knocked over about 50 times ha!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Moomin_Troll
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better: about a 10 second walk from Dam Square. The staff were very friendly and helpful when we asked for advice on where to go. There is no restaurant so breakfast was delivered to the room which was fun. On the downside the room and bathroom were very small. We had a double bed but 2 single duvets (actually quite cozy but some may not like it!) I'm not sure whether I would recommend this hotel, it depends what your priorities are. (Warning - just after arriving to our room the huge heavy window fell open onto the bed as we were sitting on it because the fixings are broken! Could've been nasty - check the window is closed!)

Reviews.Title: “Compact and Go Go Go !!”
Reviews.Author: RoozbeH
Reviews.Content: well I stayed here with my friend for three days (two of it over weekend) in a twin bed room ... the staff were super friendly in anyway since there was a problem with my credit card so they went into trouble many times emailing and calling me and upon arrival for giving me tips on where to go and how ! rooms were rather small we hardly fitted our suitcases ,rooms were totally clean so as the shower , one big deal was that there was no elevator in the hotel so u have to climb with ur suitcases up til 4 floors ( we were on the second floor) . and the rooms only have heater so not a pleasant stay in summer . Beds were to soft first it felt like a water bed but it wasn't, and the internet is 5 Euros a day . the BEST thing about the hotel is the Location ... just perfect ... located in dam square everything is around the infamous red light district is 2 min walk ,plenty of restaurants pastry shops and etc just under the hotel ,even the Train station is a 15 min walk !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: pgreen_10
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 female friends went for a mid week break . The hotel was in an excellent location. 10 minute walk from Central Station.2 minute walk to Dam Square and there were lots of eating places next to the hotel. There were 4 of us in a room together. We had 4 single beds that were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but worked perfectly for 4 ladies. The staff at the hotel were excellent and very helpful.Could not find anything to complain about. Definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location- but you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: spicycracker
Reviews.Content: *Room is small and basic but it was clean. *Beds are comfy *Bathroom is small and in the shower area it smelt like urine a bit. *We were on the second floor overlooking the street of Damstraat, and it is noisy through the night and so we didn't sleep well at all. Also the people in the room above ours kept stomping around at 7am and after a terrible night sleep was the last thing we wanted. *location right by dam square, you are central to most things like attractions and restaurants which was fantastic so we didn't have to tram it anywhere we walked. *Had to pay a 50 euros deposit when we arrived on top of the 5% city tax. We wasn't aware of paying a deposit, so that's just to warn you if you weren't informed either. Overall, if you get a room at the front be prepared for a noisy night, and it is basic but it reflects in the price and was better going to this hotel than one further out which has a bit more frills.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, but”
Reviews.Author: okie_dokie_smokie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel de Gerstekorrel during a trip last April. The number one thing to keep in mind about this hotel is that there is no elevator. We were given a room on the top floor, about 5 very steep flights up. The staircases in Amsterdam are notoriously narrow which makes this hotel feel very authentic, but after a night out on the town we questioned if we'd make it to our room... we did to say the least... The staff was extremely accommodating, and delivered breakfast to our room each morning. Breakfast was a simple banquette, a few slices of cheese, juice and coffee. My only one objection was that there was construction being done to the front of the building which completely blocked out view of the street with plastic covers & scaffolding. After hiking up 5 flights, you at least want to look out the window. One morning, I was shocked to see workers outside our window. Overall, the room was sufficient, and the price was equal to the quality of services delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good for a budget hotel in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BletchleyCat
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and were offered the choice of immediately getting into a room on the fourth floor or waiting an hour for a room on the second floor. As were were only in Amsterdam for two days we wanted to get settled as soon as possible and took the fourth floor option. The stairs were as steep as you would expect in Amsterdam, (there is no lift). However the room was larger than we expected, there was enough space to walk round the adequately sized double bed. There was also a desk and a small wardrobe. The bathroom was rather small, there was no shower tray and the placement of the loo made it difficult to sit without banging your knees if you were tall. However both rooms were very clean and nicely furnished. They were well lit and the bed was comfortable. There is no dining room but we were asked what time we wanted breakfast in our room. We thought the breakfast was good for a budget hotel, it consisted of a warmed roll, two slices of ham, two slices of cheese, spread and jam for each person together with a paper cup of good coffee. The food was fresh, the meat and cheese individually sealed and the whole thing nicely presented with a card giving .you that day's weather forecast Sugar and powdered milk were provided but you could easily get a small carton of milk from a nearby shop. The hotel is very centrally placed being two minutes walk from Dam Square and very near a supermarket. The reception staff were very friendly and there was no problem to leaving our luggage in a locked luggage room the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: Sharona6
Reviews.Content: At first when booking this hotel, I wasn't too sure from reading a few unpleasant reviews. When I got there, the room was clean apart from the burnt cigerette stains near the window, and it did have a bit of a smokey smell to it but apart from that it was fine as we were only there for two nights and the very friendly receptionists let us change the room because we asked for a double room not a twin and it was a lot more cleaner than the first one. Beds are really comfy and bathroom is very clean. The location of this hotel is excellent and if you want to stay somewhere very near the centre then this is the hotel you should pick especially if you are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Do not rate very high”
Reviews.Author: maureen045
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable, Breakfast poor, a lot to be desired. This was neither a continental nor a substantial breakfast. ie a carton of fruit juice, 1 bread roll, a small pack of cheese, a small carton of jam, a small cup of hot water and powdered milk. each( not what I would call a continental breakfast, by any means ( and I have had many). And to top that no dining room ( in a hotel), very disappointing. M&D Craig Sunderland UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Martyn1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, which to me is very important for a city break. It is literally a few steps away from Dam Square and all the major streets of Amsterdam can easily be walked to. The staff are friendly and reception is 24 hours. There are limited items for sale in reception (small fridge of soft drinks and a coffee machine) and there is no restaurant so breakfast is served to your room, however we didn't have the breakfast. I think the best thing to do is to pop into a local Albert Heijn store (they're like Tesco metro/express) and get some supplies for the room. Our room was on the 4th floor which isn't for the faint hearted! There are lots of stairs and they get steeper and steeper! It wasn't a problem for us but if you do have any problems with stairs perhaps you should request a room on a lower floor when booking. Our twin room was clean and nicely decorated, it was small but there was plenty of room to walk around the beds and had an ample wardrobe for a city break, two bedside cabinets, a desk and a TV. I found the bed too soft and the pillows were too big but thats just my preferences. The bathroom was small and didn't have anywhere to put anything but the water was hot and it was clean. We didn't have any problems with noise but we didn't get in until quite late and perhaps it is better to be on a high floor away from the street noise. Best thing was the location and worst thing was the stairs but once you go to a few places in Amsterdam you'll know that steep stairs are very common! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best balance of price vs facilities for it's central location”
Reviews.Author: Shinken69
Reviews.Content: I visit Amsterdam quite often for both business and pleasure. When Iâ€™m paying, I tend to stay in the budget end of hotels. These can be a shock to the system as real estate in Amsterdam is at a VERY high premium. Therefore, if you are booking a budget hotel, you need to expect that the room will be much smaller than you expected. However, this doesnâ€™t explain the filthy condition of some of these places. That said, the Gerstekorral offers the best balance I have found in almost 20 years of visiting Amsterdam between price & facilities. The rooms are small and basic but always clean and the staff are always helpful. There is no AC but a fan is provided. The rooms can therefore get stuffy in the summer, but if you are in Amsterdam, you should be out enjoying the city during those warm hours. The other major benefit of this hotel is itâ€™s location, just off Dam Square. However, this does mean that it can be noisy. Again, during those noisy hours, you should be out creating some noise of your own. My only real gripe with this hotel is the lack of a safe in the rooms. There is a safe at reception that you can use, but a personal safe in the room would be so much better. In my opinion, this is the best central hotel for the price. Mostly the other budget hotels are grotty stink holes by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: fabmc
Reviews.Content: This could be a nice hotel considering the central position next to Dam square. Unfortunately it lacks air conditioning and/or proper ventilation, so that rooms and corridors in the afternoon tend to get filled up with a strong kitchen smell due to all the restaurants next door. That strong smell will make your stay unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, good service - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: twixtthepennines
Reviews.Content: I sent my parents-in-law on a DFDS trip with one night in this hotel and they have just returned. This is what they have to say about the hotel. The staff spoke good English and were helpful and friendly. I emailed in advance to request a smoking room, and this is what they had on arrival. I mentioned it was for a special occasion (65th birthday), and they were surprised to find a bottle of wine and glasses waiting in the room after they had been out for a couple of hours. A very nice touch. The room size was quite adequate, and the double bed was very comfortable. The room was at the back of the hotel (not a good view, but they weren't bothered), and was quiet at night, so they had a great sleep. In the morning, breakfast arrived at the requested time in the room (two orange juices, coffee, tea, rolls, jam and cheese), and was accompanied by a weather forecast on a little card (another nice touch). The only minor gripe - the shower has no tray, and a tiled floor, no bath mat. So watch it, it's slippy. Take your own toiletries. Mum-in-law says "great, quilted loo roll"! Can't fault the central location and the room was very clean indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a chance.”
Reviews.Author: inchmeaders
Reviews.Content: We travelled as 2 couples and we booked this hotel 5 months before our trip after having read mostly good read reviews about it. We were a bit appprehensive when we checked the most recent reviews 2 days before travelling and read the one about bed bugs. However, being unable to cancel at such short notice we had to take our chances. Having booked an early flight we arrived well before check-in time but one of our 2 rooms were ready and we were able to put our luggage into it before going out for the day. (They also have a luggage room where cases can be left). We had one room on the first floor and one on the second - both 'standard doubles'. The 1st floor room was slightly larger but both were, like most city-centre hotels in Amsterdam, very small but clean - and no bed- bugs thank goodness. The beds were very comfortable and the shower rooms clean. Beware - there is no soap provided and as seems to be the norm in a lot of European countries there was no plug in the sink! Clothes storage space was abysmal - a tiny little 'hole' for hanging about 6 garments if you are lucky and an equally small cupboard with 2 shelves plus two bedside drawers - and you can't leave clothes in your suitcase as there is no room to have a case opened on the floor. We hadn't booked the breakfast option but were told by other guests that it was very poor - a bread roll and a cup of coffee from the vending machine. The reception staff were friendly and helpful but, as we found out, had very limited scope for dealing with anything out of the ordinary. We arrived back late one afternoon to find that the 1st floor room had been burgled and a camera stolen. On reporting this to reception we found that 2 other rooms had also been burgled with no signs of forced entry - suggesting that a key had been used. The thieves were obviously only after anything light and portable that could be stolen quickly and whilst we were 'lucky' in only having a camera on display, others weren't and had cameras, phones, money, credit cards etc taken. We discovered that the receptionist hadn't phoned the police and reported the burglaries and that we had to go and find the police station and report the thefts ourselves. The police couldn't have been nicer or more helpful but were none too happy that the hotel hadn't reported it themselves. On speaking to the receptionist later on - he said he had no authority to do any more than he did ( we assume there must be a manager/owner somewhere?) but was very sorry about it and did his limited best to do anything he could - he gave us a free security box for the rest of our stay and free coffee from the vending machine! This burglary was obviously an 'inside job' of some kind and if the hotel had reported it to the police I expect they would have been told to change all their locks - maybe they didn't want the expense! The big plus for this hotel is it's central location - it really can't be beaten and when you read the reviews for many other budget hotels in Amsterdam they are pretty awful. So - make of this what you will. Possibly, now it has been burgled it may be one of the safest places to stay for a while!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthaeus
Reviews.Content: This hotel its in the best location in Amsterdam, i was there for four days and i dont have any complains at all. Small but very clean room ( wc doesnt have shower duche gel or shampoo, it only has hands gel) , they clean the room everyday, and staff is very helpfull. I really dont understand all the bad coments about the stairs,all the stairs in Amsterdam are like theese, but they are not a big deal ,only if you have 200k or 90 yrs old :). Anyway,this hotel is a very good choice for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: pamelar5
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Amsterdam with DFDS from Newcastle and stayed here for one night. We found the hotel no problem having visited Amsterdam previously and had an idea where we were going. The staff were lovely and took a note of what time we required breakfast. Our room was on the top floor up a really narrow set of stairs. It was clean and massive with 3 single beds. It wasnt luxurious but we were only there for one night and it was just somewhere to rest our heads after a night on the sauce. We werent aware of any noise from the street when we had both an afternoon nap and our nights sleep. Next morning the breakfast was delivered to our room. We werent expecting much as a continental breakfast is miles away from what we regard as a breakfast here (sausage, eggs, bacon) however we were really pleasantly suprised with the warm rolls, prepacked cheese and tropicana orange juice. The tray also had a card on it that wished us a good morning and had the next 2 days weather on it which i thought was a nice touch. The hotel allowed us to store our lugguge through the day so we could go out before being picked up to go home. If i were travelling to Amsterdam again i would book directly with this hotel and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fit our needs”
Reviews.Author: DianaA8
Reviews.Content: +: conveniently located near Dam Square, staff was friendly and helpful with directions. Room was clean. Room fit our needs for our stay. -: no elevator...expect to climb stairs (very narrow, steep) Good workout...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shldnsam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was literally a block from the Dam Square - a 10 minute walk from the Central Train Station. The room was small, but apparently not much smaller than the average room in Amsterdam. The bed was comfortable. But we had NO view - we looked out onto the tiniest "courtyard" I have ever seen. But at least it was not a street view which can be very loud at all hours. The room was pretty clean, but we saw a mouse one evening! It scared us and I informed the main desk. Speaking of which, the main desk was in another building 3 doors down from where we stayed. They were obviously in the middle of remodeling - the bit where the main desk is has already been done. Unfortunately they seem to start the work at about 7.30 in the morning during the week. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful and they stored our luggage on our last day as you need to be out of the rooms by noon. And there were no tea and coffee facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Good Price, High Quality, Wonderful Service, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: David2122
Reviews.Content: I visit Amsterdam every year - it is the most beautiful city and there is so much to see. With over 40 museums in Amsterdam alone, and with The Netherlands having the highest concentration of museums in the world, we enjoy every moment and you need to be in a prime location. And that is one of the best features of the Hotel de Gerstekorrel. We travelled in October 2008 with DFDS Seaways aboard the MS King of Scandinavia. After a wonderful crossing, we stayed in the hotel for one night. This year, we are staying in the hotel for two nights, but I must say that after our first stay at the Hotel de Gerstekorrel last year, I would be more than happy and will be staying here again in 2009. On arrival, the weather was thoroughly miserable, and due to a DFDS Seaways map being wrong, it took us almost an hour to find the hotel in the rain. Every Dutch person we asked, all they told us was it was on the Dam Strad. After finding it, we were told we couldn't check in for another couple of hours, which annoyed us slightly, as we weren't told of this, but we probably wouldn't of minded if the weather wasn't so bad. It didn't ruin the trip. Because the hotel was so cheap, we expected it to be very basic and prepared for it to be very low standard in its cleanliness and quality. However, when we arrived in our room, we were delighted to find a television with lots of English and Dutch channels, a telephone, a nice clean toilet and shower (although small) and a huge room. It was the same room but on two different heights with a few steep stairs Although our room window faced out onto a wall, we came to Amsterdam to go out and explore and didn't plan to stare out the window all day. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clear and I can't express how friendly and co-operative the staff were - and moreso how great their Engish was. We received our automated wake up call right on time, and we enjoyed the continental breakfast delivered to us at our room at the exact time, sharp and prompt. It also had free WiFi, and I will taking advantage of it this year when I take my laptop. The rooms were very well heated/air conditioned, depending on the weather and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It is located just next to Dam Square, so you're near lots of major attractions - although we had quite some time walking to Science Centre NEMO - which I must say is incredibly interesting! There is a great family feel to the hotel. It is only a bed and breakfast, continental breakfast at that, but that is all you really need and it's edible. Nearby is a coffeeshop, but there is no problem with that, nobody ever bothers you. With a one minute walk to Dam Square/Madame Tussauds/Nuewie Kerk/Royal Palace, 5 minute walk to Central Station and 3 minute walk to the Red Light District, this hotel is in a prime location and its fantastic quality with great prices. If travelling with DFDS Seaways, you must purchase the Day Trip Passes (that's the A, B, C, D and E) tickets which allow you access to different attractions for a great price. I think it cost us Â£60 each, but it cost us all Â£45 to get into Madame Tussauds anyway, so it's a great deal. Lots of different attractions to enjoy. I recommend this hotel to everyone - it is true quality for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a budget”
Reviews.Author: Blissackerman1304
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights a week before Christmas whilst on a cruise package. Overall we must have paid about Â£20 for two nights for the accomadation so we didnt expect much, however, we were pleasantly surprised. ROOM: The room was small but was clean and cosy and had everything you needed. The TV helped for the morning after when you were a bit monged out! BREAKFAST: Left a lot to be desired as I usually have more than a roll and slice of cheese for breakfast! however, you only had to walk about a minute to find some cheap places to eat. Also you cant expect a full english breakfast for the price you pay! LOCATION: This hotel has probably the best location in Amsterdam, it is literally on the Dam and is a few minutes walk to shows, red light district, restuarants, madame tussaads, shopping etc. The Location is PERFECT, in my eyes I would much rather pay less, have a less star hotel and be close to everythingas opposed to paying more, having a posh hotel but be a while away from the attractions. STAFF: We encountered two different memebers of staff on out trip. Both were extremely friendly and helpful and assisted us n finding certain attractions etc. Overall I would say this hotel is perfect for non fussy people, who are on a tight budget and want to see amsterdam as opposed to relax in a hotel. I would say the only negative thing about the hotel would be breakfast and would definately recoomend to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: sunidaze
Reviews.Content: Room on third floor, steep stairs no lift, room was very small, double bed pushed against the wall, tv, tiny wardrobe.. room overlooked a brick wall. Very hot but fans available from reception at no extra cost. Clean. Staff very helpful. Breakfast delivered to your room ... continental. Great location central for all attractions, eateries etc. Fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Bex2811
Reviews.Content: On arrival the lady at the desk spoke impeccable English and was very friendly and helpful. Beds are stupidly comfy! Ensuite wetroom. Really like the fact that there was four of us and we could have 1 room. TV with loads of channels incl BBC1. Excellent location - walking distance to anywhere incl red light district, Dam Square, Central station, bars, etc. Despite being on a busy road it wasn't noisy of a night. Probably only downside was it was difficult to find as it is just a door between two fast food restaurants. Would definitely stay there again when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “steep stairs”
Reviews.Author: noodle04
Reviews.Content: If you dont do stairs easily dont stay here. There are several floors in this hotel and no lift. Our room was a split level triple bedded room. Basic and clean. Nice large flat screen tv. Continental breakfast is served in your room. The hotel is very central with a good variety of restaurants in the same street. Might recommend this to friends who are not fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: lyttle_queen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam. We initially looked for cheaper hostlels but were put off by the consistently bad (at times scary) reviews of most cheap hostels/hotels. In the end we chose to pay a little more and stayed at the Hotel De Gerstekorrel. The hotel did not disappoint and we were pleasantly surprised at how comfortable, clean, cosy and warm our room was. We stayed in a spacious and light triple,with beds designed for a good night 's sleep and we had satellite tv, heating at all times and a small but clean bathroom. Finally, the staff were very polite and helpful and the hotel has an excellent location: it is a 5-10min walk from central station (one tram stop away) and is right in the centre near Dam Square and the Red Light District.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BarryBethal
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest, this is a budget hotel ideally suited for boozy weekends in Amsterdam. At Â£60 a night this place is a bargain considering the following: 1. Amsterdam hotels can be pretty obscene tariff wise 2. It was en-suite 3. It was clean 4. It had a great location (if your intention is getting drunk) As I was travelling with my girlfriend, an en-suite was essential and from researching hotels at the time it was clear that hardly any hotels had this basic facility in a central location at a reasonable price. Spot on for the budget traveller as we were at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Ninoute
Reviews.Content: We managed to find a double room on Expedia for about 60 euros, which was a decent price for our budget. The room was small but clean and comfortable, the staff friendly, and most of all, the hotel is very well located. The only negative thing was that there was no shampoo or soap in the shower, but as long as you know it before going, it's not a big problem!

Reviews.Title: “Much more than meets the eye !”
Reviews.Author: MrStereo
Reviews.Content: From the start I have to say I have known The Gerstekorrel ("In de Gerstekorrel" as it used to be) since 1966 and have been STAYING as a "regular" since 1972.My own 2 yr.absence recently has only been due to an intractible "domestic" situation,NOT to any "loss of faith" at all..indeed..the very OPPOSITE ! YES..a very "tourist/family" type it IS.However,the CLEANLINESS,COMFORT ans sheer OBLIGING FRIENDLINESS and HELPFULNESS of the staff quite set it apart;and,the "location"..as slap-dap central as you could ever want it to be ( 1.minute from the Dam Square says-it-all).We'll gloss-over the fact that the "RLD" ("Walletjes"..or whatever) is just 3.minutes the other way !!!!! Moreover,the lingustic professionalism of the staff,especially at reception is almost "university" level,with their considerable personal Warmth enhancing their commitment that "no request is ever too small",for them to go out of their way to help you ! This and the other points DO,without question,offset the "touristy" and a little "noisy" situation -only to be reasonably expected for a location such as that in a city of the size and vibrancy of Amsterdam. Finally,one last and HUGELY HONOURABLE and GREATLY RESPECTED point about this hotel. Just after it opened at the beginning of WW 11,after Holland was invaded,not surprisingly, the hotel was occupied by The Wehrmacht.from time to time (and,I believe,more than that even),the then owners,at a HUGE risk to themselves,sheltered people of the Jewish faith -in the cellar; right under the noses of the German military -upstairs !! It has been an honour to write this report..and GOD BLESS to all ! Cheers, "Mr.Stereo"

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly basic”
Reviews.Author: tasteslikefame
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the perfect location, its in the center of all the major attractions in amsterdam. the room was clean and tidy and breakfast was basic but delivered to our room at our preferred time. it was quiet on a night which was bliss. the only problem is that theres no stairs and we were on top floor (3rd floor) which was slightly annoying but good excercise!

Reviews.Title: “Mission”
Reviews.Author: J0bba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel De Gerstekorrel 16/08/08 - 18/08/08 and it was rubbish we got put in a different building with loads of stairs about 70 steps or something. We were dead by the time we got up the stairs. Breakfast well how tasty "bread roll, cheese slice, tea with no milk, orange juice with loads of bits of crap in". Location ok close to everything coffeshops, red light district, bars, munch!! so quite good for location. Staff seem nice too! Ohh almost forgot our excellent view of Roof Tops and crap on roofs. So overall good location and thats all it has going for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for young people”
Reviews.Author: kandy-pops
Reviews.Content: Ok people, we know why we go to Amsterdam, its to party and "sightsee" and "relax". You spend all your money and most of your time doing that, so you don't need to waste money on a posh hotel, and you also don't want to spend all your time watching Sky TV in your room, This is Amsterdam, it rocks. The hotel is just off Dam square like people are saying. Its less than 10mins walk from the station (if you know where you are going) so within 20mins of getting off the train you can be out getting trashed. Absolutely fantastic location, 5 mins from Red light district, hundreds of bars, coffee shops etc. I'd been before so I knew where the street was, although we did walk past the hotel at first because it is just a door in between 2 restaurants/fast food bits so keep your eyes open! The only thing we were a bit suprised at that was when we (2 girls) checked in, we were given a room on the 4th floor which is the top one. That is 73 stairs, I counted them, no lift and the guy on the front desk didn't offer to give us a hand with our stuff. Our twin room was tiny, our friends had a room on the 3rd floor though that was much bigger. Oh and the bathroom is comedy, so tiny but we didn't care, money saved for other things! The room was clean and we had fresh towels etc every day. We didn't ask for breakfast but there are LOADS of restaurants on your doorstep. This hotel is great if you want cheap and cheerful and have other things that your money is going on. Make the most of being in such a special city and live a little!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Livus
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is amazing - go there! If youÂ´re looking for a great hotel - donÂ´t stay at the Gerstekorrel. If youÂ´re looking for a basic hotel (with tiny rooms!) but an excellent location - stay at the Gerstekorrel. We did not bother to change our room for a better one, but I wish we did. Our room was on the 4.th or 5.th floor (canÂ´t remember), and the stairs are really steep. When finally finishing climbing the stairs, we found the smallest room ever; we could hardly move around in there. Suitable for 1 person, not 2. Extremely tiny. We stayed for 3 nights, but did never have our beds made or towels changed. Probably because we slept "all day" because of partying all night... :-) With that said: the receptionist was friendly and welcoming, every morning we had breakfast brought to our room, the location is excellent (very close to the Dam) and we had a small (tiny!) balcony where we could look down at whatever going on in the street below. Ok hotel - nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mysteriousgirl03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 14th - 19th February 2008. Upon arrival the reception staff were polite, welcoming and friendly, and the process of checking in was quick and easy. Our room was on the 2nd floor, at the back of the hotel. Whilst the room was smaller then we expected, it was clean and had everything we needed. The bathroom looked recently renovated, with a wet room style shower. Towels were changed every day, and the room cleaned. We didnt have any problem with noise, being at the back of the hotel it was away from the main street and therefore quiter. Breakfast was delivered to the room every morning, a time having being arranged the previous day, and consisted of a fresh warm bread roll, cheese, jam, butter, a strawberry&orange smoothie, tea or coffee and an After Eight chocolate! Everything was fresh and individually packed. We stayed 5 days and all of the reception staff and cleaning staff we came across during our stay were helpful and friendly at all times. We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cheap base for the RLD”
Reviews.Author: jnrmotley
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend (both male/mid 20s) stayed here for a few days in Feb '08. I've stayed in some 'hell hole hotels' in Amsterdam before (Delta) and also some really nice ones (Victoria Plaza). This Hotel was a good compromise between the two. No frills, but cheap and clean. It's major plus point is the location for Red Light District. It's just off Dam Square and a minute away from the Coffee Shops, Bars and the other RLD attractions. Because of this, it is noisy outside, but it didn't bother me as I had a belly full of Heineken and would of slept through an earthquake. I had read reports on TR about the steep steps. We were on the third floor and they were a bit of a pain, but nothing too troublesome. However if I were to stay here again, I would ask if there was a room on the first or second floor available. Housekeeping service was great and the staff were very friendly. Couple of bits of advice... 1) When you are trying to find the hotel the wording 'Hotel De Gerstekorrel' is written very small on the sign. We walked passed it several times. The large wording on the sign is 'DAM STRAT' 2) If you are planning on leaving your bags there before check-in, you should get there as early as possible. They do have a place to leave your bags but it is only a small cupboard. We arrived at 10:30am and the cupboard was already full.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bheat2615
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel included very cheaply in a DFDS Ferry 3nt package (whole trip, ferry 2nt and hotel 1nt cost us Â£75 each) So for the price I was blown away. We bookd a twin room but when we got there the room we had was non-smoking, we said at reception that we needed a smoking room and with no hassle whatsoever they said one would be avalible by 1pm, and it was a double, which is what we really wanted. Plus it was on the 2nd floor instead of the 4th which didnt go amiss.The staff also provided a hairdryer and iron on request. The staff, clearly are very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect, literally a one minute walk from Dam Square (though we walked past it a couple of times as it really doesnt stand out) The rooms, at least the two I saw were clean with satalite TV and en-suite bathroom. The bathroom was tiny but I got a laugh from resting the side of my head on the wall while sitting on the toilet. Although the bathroom was a little crampd there was ample room to use all the facilities. The room itself didnt feel cramped and the bed was very comftable. Breakfast consisted of a choice of tea coffee and orange juice with bread, cheese, jam etc. very basic but as I didnt even think breakfast was included it was welcome. It was left on a tray outside the room in the morning. It was very noisey from about 11:30pm well into the early hours of the morning, especialy since we had the window open because we were smoking. However this didnt bother me too much, and being right, quite unbeleivably, in the centre of the city centre, was to be expected. Ive given this hotel a five rating, but thats in the constraints of a budget hotel. If I'd paid enough to expect a 4 or five star hotel this would be a let down, but I expected a B&B for what I paid and got so much more. If your on a budget and want someware smack bang in the centre of things with friendly staff, comftable rooms and havnt got bad legs look no further. If stairs are a problem find someware els.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: tg49ers
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a European vacation and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The best part of this hotel is the location, it is located in central Amsterdam, close to restaurants, bars, and shopping. You are also 3 minutes from the Red Light District area. When we arrived at the hotel, you can definately tell that the hotel was not going to be a high end hotel, it is very very basic, we got a "quad" room, to sleep 4 adults. You have to take the stairs up to the rooms, which are pretty narrow. The rooms are clean but very small, same with the bathrooms, very very small. At first thought we thinking to ourselves "what did we get ourselves into?" but at the end of our stay, I think we were all happy that we stayed there, mainly because the rooms weren't that bad but we were so central to everything. It is nice to go out late at night and be walking distance back to the hotel. You would never have to leave this area as it is so close to all the hot spots. If you are looking for the Hilton, this is not it, it is at best a two star, but the rooms are clean, it can get a little loud at nights but once you close the windows, it's not all that bad. The front desk staff were very very helpful and spoke good english. Overall, the location speaks for itself, the rooms were as basic as you can get but I knew that prior to booking. Grab this place if you are not fussy about having top notch rooms, and if you want to be close to the action, you will save your money on cabs alone by grabbing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Highland_Lassie75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after cruising over from Newcastle for one night to spend a day and a half in Amsterdam before cruising back. This was my second time staying in Amsterdam, the first time staying at the Amstel Botel and found this experience far superior. Really wasn't expecting anything spectacular but the rooms were clean which is all I really care about for a one or two night stay. The best thing was the staff, they couldn't have been any friendlier if they tried and it really made the whole experience pleasurable. As stated by others the only problem we had was with the stairs to the rooms as they were very steep which was quite a challenge trying to negotiate up my 2 year old nephew, his buggy, our suitcases, oh and his pregnant mother (lol). But at the end of the day it is Amsterdam so what else do you expect. All in all a very pleasurable experience and would definitely book there again as the location is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has a narrow entrance squeezed in between a pizza place and a Wok to Go take-away with rooms on 5 floors, via steep narrow steps. The hotel is Dutch-Finnish owned with mostly staff from Finland and with Finnish magazines in the reception area. Room info is in English, Dutch and Finnish. The staff are VERY friendly. I got a big room for myself alone, bright, nicely decorated, with big desk, a TV on the wall, flat screen but not wide sreen, 35 channels via the cable, incl. BBC 1 and 2 and BBC World. Nice bathroom with shower. I did not find it noisy, even being on the street side. It is very clean, good beds (3 in my triple room). Price I paid was 99 Euro through a Dutch website [--], cheaper than via Booking.com. No credit card needed via this website I used.Not cheap but normal for Amsterdam. Location is very near Dam square, opposite rooms of the 5-star Krasnapolsky, ideal location I think, walking distance from central station and most sights in Amsterdam. For eating dinner in your room the next-door take-aways are ideal and cheap. No minibar in hotel room, no airco but a table fan, which I found to be VERY necessary in summer. Without it it would be too hot for me in summer in this hotel, but the fan means of course the room will not be quiet at night. In the reception you can get drinks and even toiletries. in bathroom there's only a dispenser on the wall, bring own toiletries. All in all a good place to stay, especially outside summer months. I am Dutch but stayed here because of a very early flight and evening activity in Amsterdam. Had to leave to early to say anything about breakfast but it is served in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: ScottishTraveller77
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb for bars, shops, restaurants, trams. We paid for and expected a budget hotel and were pleasantly surprised that it was far nicer than we had anticipated. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Our allocated room was on a different floor from our teenage children and the receptionist immediately said it wasn't a problem to change and gave us rooms on the same floor. Rooms were ready early and we were able to check in immediately. Rooms are pleasant (though not particularly large) with neutral decoration, beds comfortable, linen fresh and clean, showers worked well. Rooms facing the front can be noisy when the windows are open (the children had no problem with this) but the rooms at the back are very quiet. We had our breakfast delivered to our rooms every day at a time to suit us (warm rolls, jam, coffee, juice). We were able to leave our luggage in the hotel's locked storage room on our day of departure. We have been to Amsterdam on a number of occasions but this was our first stay at this hotel. We would not hesitate to book this one for our next trip. The only downside would be that the stairs are very steep and it is a little awkward to carry cases up and down. Certainly wouldn't be suitable for disabled people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic and clean”
Reviews.Author: 75kempy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 1 night stay here and found the hotel to be a great overnight stay. The rooms are basic but clean, the location is perfect just off Dam square. The only down side to this hotel are the stairs up to the rooms very steep and no lift..... we stayed on the 4th floor it was a work out, but not impossible. Breakfast was nice served to your room nice fresh warm bread and tea or coffee and OJ too. Overall we found it to be a good place to stay for a quick stop off from our cruise. Would stay again if I returned to Amsterdam .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent no-frills base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Tallulah3
Reviews.Content: The rooms are simply furnished but very clean & very comfortable & the staff were pleasant & obliging. We were able to check in straight away & on departure leave our luggage until it was time to meet our coach. Unless you want luxurious surroundings or an all-inclusive holiday I don't think you can beat this hotel as a base for your sightseeing as it is just off Dam Square. As you come out of the hotel turn left for the most fantastic bakery on this planet, turn right out of the hotel for a charming Fantasy shop selling Trolls, fairies etc. The noise didn't bother us even with the window open but if we stayed there in the summer I would probably request a room on the other side so that we could have our windows open at night. The location was excellent & I would happily stay there again. I don't like steep stairs but found these were ok especially as we had requested a room that was on the 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jockmeister97
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from amsterdam were we stopped for 4 nights in the Hotel De Gerstekorrel our key factor in booking this hotel was location and we weren't dissapointed at all our triple room was adequate for our purposes room was cleaned every day i'd have no problem booking this hotel again but if i was going for a weekend away with a woman i'd pick something a little more luxurious

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: gringbam
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam 3 times now and the last two were spent at this hotel. The staff are all so friendly and helpful. The rooms are fairly basic but clean and tidy. We asked for a front facing room which had fab views of dam straat. We plan to visit Amsterdam each year and will definetly be returning here! The location is just too good to resist. Dam square is a minute away and there are some really good coffeshops close by. Would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Shame On Management”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerParisFr
Reviews.Content: I mistakenly relied upon the tripadvisor reviews about this well located hotel. What a mistake as their rooms desperately need major maintenance/decoration work and a very good clean. Avoid this place as there are many better value for money options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!! Suited a young crowd/couple”
Reviews.Author: Jamesandgrainne
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam 3 times now and this by far has been the best for location! Its just of Dam Square and in a very busy street with a beautiful Argentian Steak house next door. There were 9 of us in total on my stag do, and we had a ball! There are a few things though to note. The stairs are very steep and would not suit an old person or someone with say back/weight problems. The cost we paid was 50 euros per night without breakfast included which was hefty enough.
