However if you are like me and want to do Amsterdam properly and are not too bothered with elegant and quiet surroundings then its not an issue . We were able to walk from central station about 10 minutes to the Hotel and everything was so close! I would recommend also that you visit Susies Saloon which is a bar just around the corner. It has a pool tabel and between 4pm-6pm its 2 euros a pint of ice cold Heinekein (beautiful) Do Not buy drink from the Bulldog bar!!!!!! It cost us 70 euros for 1 round of beers and one wiskey was 8 euro! Getting back to the Hotel , the staff were friendly and to sum it up its clean, comfortable and really, really, central. Would I stay here again ? Yes definitley . Would it be everybodys cup of tea? Probably not. But if your young fit and ready to party , its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this was the worst value for money i have ever spent on a hotel. the room was overpriced dirty, smelled like mould and noisy noisy noisy !!! in my experience you can get a better deal in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jackfla5h
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, comfortable and in a superb location right in the centre of Amsterdam(Dam Sq/Red Light). We had a triple room which worked out a Â£90 a night between us which is great value. Would definitely recommend this hotel for young couples and groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Adequate”
Reviews.Author: kyle7Uk
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth time visiting Amsterdam in the past 12 years, but our first at the Hotel De Gerstekorrel - selected purely for location, it certainly didn't disappoint on that score (very central indeed); while the accommodation itself is somewhat basic (more or less what you would expect for a hotel in the low to mid price range), the room itself was clean and more than adequate for our needs - and with friendly and helpful staff too, I'd definitely consider staying here again. Whilst the rooms to the front (overlooking Damstraat) can be noisy at night, they are slightly bigger (and in my opinion preferable) to those located at the side - we actually changed rooms to be at the front, so for us noise was not an issue; for some it may be though... With that in mind, I'd say this hotel would most appeal to the 20 - mid 40's age bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: BraveSirRobin
Reviews.Content: A basic but clean hotel. Perfect location just off Dam Square with a pastry shop one side and a fab chinese the other. The nearest 'coffee' shop was about 2 minutes away and the red light district 5 minutes away. It's about 10 minutes walk at most from the train station which in turn is 3.40 euros and 20 minutes from the airport. I will definately use this as my base again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Amsterdam for the first time and stayed at this hotel. I picked it due to the location, of which turned out to be excellent. It was in walking distance of all main attractions. I think it was a good 3/4 hour walk to museum area, but there are lots of things to see and do on way. The hotel itself was presentable. We arrived mid afternoon to find that we were in room 40 - on the fourth floor with no lift! The stairs are quite steep, but managable, by the end of our stay we could get to the top without being out of breath!! The staff were very friendly and helpful, the reception was 24 hour. The information at reception for sightseeing was good (I recommend looking through 'Boom' Magazine for handy tips on where to go). The room was cleaned daily, with no extra cost incurred. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there were so many cafes / bars that served breakfast and we like wandering around! We caught a train from airport to Central Station and walked it down to the hotel (which is about a 20 min walk down Damrak. You will pass a S-- Museum - this is rubbish. Also theres Teasers, which was 13 euro for two large beers - the dearest we paid, but my husband wasn't complaining!! Also on the left (opposite teasers on other side of road) is the Grasshopper Bar, well worth going into. We got round a few sights. We thought the museum entrance fee were a little steep. We went to Anne Franks House, which was alright (a bit depressing though!). It was a shame that the front had been altered to a modern looking buidling but I suppose this was required. We went in Hollands Casino, which is quite a grand building (don't forget picture id or you won't get in!), we had a quick walk around the Vondelpark, but due to the terrential rain we didn't see much of this. We did plan to hire bikes (there is a shop very close to hotel for this), but the weather put us off. The flower Market is good for soveniers, and I thought were the cheapest. I liked the Leidesplein and the Rembrantplein for drinking and meals. We went round the Red Light District Area a couple of times. The bars, are alright round here. I did not like the Old Sailor as it was always jammed packed with lads and a bit off putting. We went in the Casa Rossa S-- Show (recommended to be the best one). I thought it may have been a bit more racy, but the comment from the couple at the side of me kind of summed it up when the lady commented that her husband could dance better than the lady on stage.......Also the bar staff were very somber, and you were hard pushed to get them to serve you. We went for a smoke (something we have no real knowledge of), we were recommended to try thr Stones Cafe (about a 5 min walk from hotel) and the Bulldog (walk right from hotel and first left before canal or go over canal and then next left!! you'll see the signs). This is very commercialised so for people like us who didn't know what they were doing - ideal! I think though for the more expert smoker they would be a bit rubbish and overpriced. The bulldog cocktail bar on Leidesplein (I think) is well worth visiting in the evening. The bar opposite the hotel (Zwart) on the corner of Dam Square was my favourite. It played 70s and 80s music and has a good atmosphere. Overall I recommend you look through the Boom Magazine to give you some ideas, it also has vouchers in which came in handy (this magazine was in reception). The Hotel is worth staying at if you just want somewhere to put your stuff and go to sleep. I would stay there again definetely.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6680
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the single rooms at this Hotel twice, it only has two single rooms on the first floor, rooms 11 and 12. they are small, you can reach out and touch either wall, the room has a small TV mounted high above you. You do get a shower and toilet, no bath, the room window over looks a busy main road and may not suit the light sleeper the view is of the side of the Krasnapolsky Hotel. its within 200 yards of Dam Square. The Staff are OK, there is a resturant attached to the side of the hotel if you want food, there is a Vending Machine for soft drinks / beer / water. As for location you cant beat this hotel for the price, the hotel only has stairs, no lift. All in all i would stay again. Ideal for the 'just need a bed' person. dont expect a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: gemmasb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very reasonably priced, it is right on Dam Straat just off Dam Square. The room was ensuite with wet room, which was basic but clean. The staff were always friendly although the stairs were steep.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They charged us extra for having a friend stay past the time of 12 am. Also they charged my credit card for cleaning charges which were unnessecary. They also only cleaned our room once during the five room stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Gerstekorrel
HotelInfo.Address: Damstraat 22-24, Amsterdam 1012 JM, The Netherlands
